sentences: Ta on abiellunud ja elab koos abikaasaga.
Pärast abiellumist kolis nad uue korteri.
context: The word 'abiellud' is the past participle form of the verb 'abielluma', which means to get married or wed. In Estonian, this form typically indicates that someone has gotten married and is in a married state. It's commonly used when referring to people who have recently married or are describing their marital status.
